Using 200404220800, I got this error. Eclipse closed and I had to restart.

There is a leak in the SWT handles.

Could you please tell me where the leak was?

Thanks.
In NewProgressViewer I didn't dispose of the icons created for every task.

I am getting this error in I200405140800 so I am reopening the bug. It's 
happening repeatedly, after using the workbench for a short time.

I realize the exception log isn't all that useful since it only represents the 
unlucky code that requested a handle after they'd all leaked, but here it is 
anyway:

The .log in comment #4 looks completely unrelated to the original problem.
The only common thing is the SWTError: No more handles
But this does seem to be enough evidence to reopen this bug.

I'm confident that I've fixed the original problem.

If you still see the problem in reent builds, please create a new bug report.

Oops, it should have read:
"But this does *not* seem to be enough evidence to reopen this bug."

traces.message: Widget is disposed()  of bundle <missing argument>.
